intro: Leuconymphaea, commonly known as the golden trumpet. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its leaves are lance-shaped and glossy, while the stems are typically upright and branching. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
